info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 4:17PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT WESTERN SWEET GRASS AND NORTH CENTRAL PARK COUNTIES THROUGH 500 PM MDT... At 416 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles west of Clyde Park, or 16 miles northeast of Bozeman, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail and torrential rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Clyde Park and Wilsall. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
